Articles.Content:
So this game is a reverse of the game telephone, if you don't know what that is, it's where the first person in a line says a word to the next, the next person repeats what he/she heard,the goal of telephone tt

is to have the last person get what the first person said.

This game instead has the first person (in this case myself) says a phase, and the next poster changes one word, the result is something completely different.

Here is the phase. (Yes it's from the ksp wiki)

[TABLE=width: 60%]

[TR]

[TD]Ã¢â‚¬Å“[/TD]

[TD]*The largest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a vast amount of fuel in a friendly orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT orange flavored and should NOT be tasted.*[/TD]

[TD]Ã¢â‚¬Â[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

To refresh this, I will post another phrase each week, or if it becomes to the point where the posters say the game is "dead" (see page 10)

if you've been ninja'd, just go with the reply above.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-22T15:14:38Z" title="03/22/2015 03:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 22, 2015</time> by MrWalrus123**

The largest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a vast amount of fuel in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT orange flavored and should NOT be tasted.

The largest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a vast amount of **rage** in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT orange flavored and should NOT be tasted.

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a vast amount of rage in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT orange flavored and should NOT be tasted.

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a tiny amount of rage in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT orange flavored and should NOT be tasted.

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a tiny amount of rage in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT waffle flavored and should NOT be tasted.

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a tiny amount of rage in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT waffle flavored and should **definitely** be tasted. 

How about everyone puts the changed word in bold so we can see it easier?

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the **Thermos**-64 holds a tiny amount of rage in a spiteful orange insulated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT waffle flavored and should definitely be tasted.

> 
> How about everyone puts the changed word in bold so we can see it easier?

Psh, but that makes it *too* easy to see! You gotta take in the whole thing, try and find what's changed! In my opinion, anyway.

---

The tiniest tank available from Rockomax, the Jumbo-64 holds a tiny amount of rage in a spiteful orange refrigerated container. Contrary to popular belief, the Jumbo-64 is NOT waffle flavored and should definitely be tasted.
Uh oh, I ninja'd you. What do we do, OP? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

> 
> Psh, but that makes it *too* easy to see! You gotta take in the whole thing, try and find what's changed! In my opinion, anyway.
